title: Grocery List Helper
description: An app to help a user store fun activities and turn them into dates. Built with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and JSON server.

title: Financial Goals
description: An app to empower users' financial decisions by providing a system to enter account balances, track transactions, and create financial goals.
bullets: Programmed a single-page web application with streamlined navigation for a seamless user experience by applying fundamental React and React Router patterns
Developed a lightweight interactive interface to increase user motivation and engagement by employing intuitive data visualization techniques for goal progress representation
Researched solutions to ensure accurate floating-point calculations resulting in improved accuracy and reliability by implementing an external 3rd party library
Leveraged Chrome/React Devtools and strategic console statements to monitor app state and methodically debug errors, leading to improved stability

title: Movie Social
description: A movie library app with search functionality, enabling users to save, rate, and review films.
bullets: Integrated a comprehensive RESTful API featuring ~500,000 movies and TV shows, enabling partial title search functionality resulting in a more efficient and accessible user experience
Implemented Semantic-UI React, providing a quick solution for consistent design to expedite development time yielding a visually appealing user interface
Incorporated full CRUD capabilities in a lightweight Sinatra back-end to handle frontend requests for data resulting in seamless data management and manipulation

title: It's a Date
description: An app for users to create and store fun activities to turn into date nights.
bullets: Optimized React app with Recoil, reducing dependencies between components to improve maintainability, scalability, and readability
Built back-end with full CRUD capabilities and validations in Ruby on Rails, increasing data management and data integrity throughout the application
Employed Bcrypt hashing on the back-end and authentication routes on the front-end to ensure user privacy
